meanings.definition: The act of erasing or removing something.
meanings.sent1: She made an erasure on the paper to correct her mistake.
meanings.sent2: The erasure of the pencil marks left the page clean.
meanings.sent3: The erasure of the cake from the plate was so quick, it seemed like magic.
meanings.sent4: His apology was like an erasure of all the hurtful words he had said.
meanings.sent5: The erasure of the graffiti from the wall revealed a beautiful mural underneath.

meanings.definition: The state of being erased or removed.
meanings.sent1: The erasure of the data from the computer was irreversible.
meanings.sent2: The erasure of her name from the list surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: The sudden erasure of his memory made him forget his own birthday.
meanings.sent4: The erasure of the footprints in the sand by the waves was calming to watch.
meanings.sent5: The erasure of the mistake from the report saved the team from embarrassment.

meanings.definition: A mark or spot that has been erased.
meanings.sent1: The erasure on the whiteboard was barely visible.
meanings.sent2: The erasure on the document revealed a hidden message.
meanings.sent3: The erasure on the painting made it look like a work in progress.
meanings.sent4: The erasure on the map confused the travelers about the correct route.
meanings.sent5: The erasure on the chalkboard showed where the mistake had been corrected.
